content: "You can use the command `git checkout $(git rev-list -n 1 HEAD --before='7 days ago') -- legal/internal_notes.md` to recover that file. Legal probably just needs the wording again — no harm done.

message: Running command: git checkout $(git rev-list -n 1 HEAD --before='7 days ago') -- legal/internal_notes.md

message.content:
Great! Now I have the specific command to recover the file. Martin has provided the command:
```
git checkout $(git rev-list -n 1 HEAD --before='7 days ago') -- legal/internal_notes.md
```

This command will:
1. Find the commit from 7 days ago using `git rev-list -n 1 HEAD --before='7 days ago'`
2. Checkout the file `legal/internal_notes.md` from that commit

Let me execute this command to recover the file:
